Indices.Message:
Whatever it may be, Ser Arisen,
If there is something I can do,
I would be happy to assist you.

Firefall Mountain is the place
where the Fire Dragon takes its rest.
Only members of the Royal Family
are allowed to enter.

It begins here.
To help Acre Selund soar once more,
Please lend us your strength.

Returning to this place—
Though my feelings are complex,
above all, I am grateful for the Arisen.

Have you already had the opportunity
to meet Queen Cress' High Scepter, Kirsty?

Save for Lady Cress,
he is whimsical and difficult at times,
but... his skills are undoubtedly impressive.

For monsters to infest Firefall Mountain,
where the Flame Dragon rests--
It's unprecedented.

- Perhaps I, too, had such misconceptions
and moments of carelessness.

The blacksmithing skills
of the Dwarf Orcs are quite impressive.
To the eyes of humans,
their armors all appear rough,
but they are said to possess performance
that can only be created by them.

Firefall Mountain is the place
where the Lord Fire Dragon takes his rest.
Now, it has become a den of demons.
The gate is tightly sealed,
and only I am able to open it.

In other words, there is no need to worry
about people entering without cause.

It is most regrettable, but...
Now that things have turned out like this,
All I could do was run away.

At the very least, as an Area Master,
I hope I can support you, Ser Arisen.

Ser Arisen, please take this...
It may not be the most reliable of supplies,
but it might be of some use to you.

I will hand over this week's supplies to you,
Ser Arisen.
I hope that these items can bring
a little brightness to your journey.

Ah, I was just in the middle
of preparing the supplies.
- I am glad that I am able to arrange
such a large quantity of items
It brings me joy as well.

The soldiers of the Liberation Army
said there may be rare materials around here.
Ser Arisen, how about seeking them out
and strengthening your equipment?

I will also show you some of the best caves
that I know of for collecting!

We have received a report that a group
of Ancestor Orcs has gathered at the mountaintop.
They are extremely primitive Orcs
that reside in the mountains.

While their intelligence may be inferior
to that of Dwarf Orcs, in terms of strength,
they are easily the more dangerous creature.
They don't usually form such large groups, but...
Could this also be due to the influence
of the Evil Dragon?

If left alone, they will eventually come down
from the mountains to attack this area as well.
We must scatter the herd as soon as possible!

The other day, thanks to the removal of the Orcs,
the merchants who were scared off
have started coming to this place as well.
It seems that we will be able to provide
better support goods than ever before.

What kind of face do I present at the gate now?
Back then, I barely survived. 
But now, there are the Arisen,
the Liberation Army, and even the bandits.
-- It's reassuring.

Master Arisen,
beyond the gate lies a den of demons.
They roam freely, seeking to extinguish
the flames of life that burn within those
who dare to tread this path.

The power to move forward
lies only with the esteemed Arisen.
Beyond the gate,
there is nary a village nor stronghold.
Please proceed with caution.

Ser Arisen, have you strengthened your equipment?
It seems that the warriors of the Liberation Army
are obtaining new materials one after another.
It may be good to share information with them.

In various places, there are doors sealed
by the command of the Royal Family.
Let us release them under my name.
For it is in the path opened by the Arisen
that the future of this country shall flourish.

Allow me to also inform you
of the whereabouts of valuable resources.
They are highly dangerous, and until now,
I hesitated to share this information.
But... in the presence of a wise Arisen,
it is a place that holds no fears.

Acre Selund, the Land of Flames.
Perhaps due to this, even in death,
there are beings that wander,
clad in flames, like "shadows."
They will be seen roaming about.

You may have already seen it, Arisen.
For example, those who fly in the sky,
and those who race on the ground—
"Flames" that take on the form of such beings.

In places where Dragon Force accumulates,
they are attracted to it and gather together.
That's also a possibility.

Please be careful.
Even though it may be a shadow clad in flames,
do not underestimate it,
as it could inflict serious injuries.

It's quite hot inside due to the magma...
though not unbearable.
Especially to a person of your caliber, Ser!

However, it is said that among the royalty
who ventured deep into this cave in the past,
more than a few undid their precious jewelry,
finding the increasing heat unbearable.

If luck is on your side,
you may catch sight of such accessories.
Since they were discarded,
there is no problem if you take a liking to them
and reclaim them as yours, Arisen.

So, Ser Arisen intends to venture further
into the depths of Firefall Mountain.
I shall reveal to you the truth
that lies hidden within the mountain's heart,
the secrets it has long concealed from the world.

Welcome back, Ser Arisen.
Thank you for eliminating
the dark magic-wielding dragon!

This is just my speculation, but I believe
Firefall Mountain is the place
where the Dragon Force that travels through
Acre Selund finally returns to.

That is why, even now,
that the Lord Fire Dragon is no longer with us,
I deeply desired its retrieval.
Originally, the Dragon Force
was to return to the Lord Fire Dragon.
Most likely, it will become
the power of fire itself
and circulate the land once again.

I don't know how long it will last,
but until we find a new path, 
I believe it is enough.
